page.title: 04A LUSTON FARMER'S DAY
page.content: I get up out of bed at 6 o'clock and have a cup of coffee and go and get the cows into the{milking}parlour by 6.30a.m.By then Dennis, who is my {dairyman,}comes and takes care of the milking.Everything in the{dairy}must be spotlessly clean.Then I do the mucking out,feed the calves and the cows after they have been milked.At about 8.00a.m.I have my breakfast. I also do my business calls on the telephone at this time.On Mondays I take the barren cows to{Ludlow market. After I've finished I come and have my dinner.At this time of year, being July,I am busy{harvesting}the hay.By 4.00p.m.the cows have been collected and are ready for milking.My tea is normally ready by about 6.00p.m.If the weather has been fine during the day, the hay harvesting continues in the evening.
